content.description: Squat start with your left hand on the jug rail of PDC and your right hand in an undercling out low and right. Climb up and right to top out just left of the tree in the rock.
content.location: It is between PDC and Pretty Damn Cool.

content.description: Stack The Cracks is a mellow climb for beginners and one for warming up. Climb moderate movement to huge holds with a thoughtful topout - chill for people who can climb harder, but it will make beginners a little nervous. Exit to the right of the small tree that's growing in the cracks near the top. The fall is clean, and the landing is good, so go for it.
content.location: Stand start to the left of the start of Slanty Traverse. See the photo.

content.description: This is a nice, long, 20 yard traverse along the upward sloping crack on the south wall of the Corridor. Start on the lower right side, and work your way left along the crack rail up to the end of the line above Love PDC (V3). The topout is about 15' off the ground. There are lots of smears and small footholds.
content.location: It's a big obvious diagonal seam descending from left to right on the western edge of the south wall of the Corridor.

content.description: This is a run and jump problem. Kick off the little incut right below the "PDC" graffiti and grab on to the big jug rail. From there, work straight up, and top out. This is definitely a bit height-dependent but fun once you get it.
content.location: This is in the middle of the South Wall right where the "PDC" graffiti is.

content.description: Sit start underneath the divingboard block, and go straight up. Exit by going right over the divingboard block.
content.location: About 15 feet to the left of "Love PDC," look for an overhand block that sits on top of the cliff band at around 7 feet up with a white streak that marks the route. There is a tree to the left of the route.

content.description: This is super fun and short. Sit start under the graffiti "Love". Go left along the slanted vertical crack above the peace symbol graffiti, and top out.   It is reachy for short people (like me).
content.location: Just to the left of "Love PDC, sit start under the graffiti "Love".

content.description: This is a fun route on the south wall of the Corridor opposite the small cave-thing. Begin with a sit start at the obtuse V, work up to a set of nasty crimps mid-wall, then shoot for the horizontal crack above and top out.
content.location: It is on the south wall of the Corridor opposite the small cave-type feature on the north wall. The cliff face around this climb has been "decorated" with graffiti at various points, including the "Love" and "PDC" scrawls that flank the climb.

content.description: Sit start with good holds just to the left of the graffiti "Jibb". Go straight up. The crux is pulling up from the sit.
content.location: It is about 5 feet right from "Over the Divingboard" and about 10 feet left of "Love PDC."

content.description: Sit start on far side of the wall on a large jug. Move up on slopers and crimp rails staying off the crack just left. Climb up and over the bulge.
content.location: It is on the far right side of the wall.

content.description: This is the South wall of the corridor formation in the Middlesex Fells.
